Package io.github.cantido.qlearner.client

Base classes that must be implemented by this library's clients.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Environment
    The space in which Actions can be performed.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    Action
    An act that can be performed that will lead to a change in the Environment's current State.
    State
    A condition that you want to reward or discourage the system from arriving at.

Package io.github.cantido.qlearner.client Description

Base classes that must be implemented by this library's clients.

Implementations of the Environment interface represent some system (real-world or otherwise) that you are trying to affect. This program will use a single instance of your Environment implementation to fetch data at every learning iteration. An Environment provides its current state in a State object, provided by Environment.getState().

Implementations of the State interface represent certain conditions of the system you are trying to affect. If your Environment has a temperature property, then a State would be a temperature sensor reading. A State has a Reward value that represents how desirable that State is. The program tries to maximize positive rewards and minimize negative rewards.

Warning: This program does not yet have the functionality necessary to learn continuous values. You must build your State objects to round these continuous values to the point where it is likely that the program will see that value again. For instance, you could round temperature readings to a lower precision. See QualityHashMap for more information.

Implementations of the Action interface represent a thing that can be done to affect the Environment. This program tries to learn the best Action to take for a given State. Each call to Agent.takeNextAction() will call Action.run() once.
